definition: to injure by scratching or clawing
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch

sentences.english: Police believe the perpetrators who should be left scratch marks on her tower.
sentences.chinese: 警方相信凶手身上应留有姬塔抓伤的痕迹。

sentences.english: The cat revenged herself on him by scratching him.
sentences.chinese: 那只猫抓伤他向他报仇。

sentences.english: Of roots at the top and the much-scratched metal ferrule and spike at the base.
sentences.chinese: 根顶部和急需抓伤的金属箍和扣球的基础。

sentences.english: Do not use any kind of abrasive that might scratch the gold.
sentences.chinese: 不要使用任何一种可能抓伤磨料黄金。

sentences.english: The city has been the number of dog bites or scratches on his 5523 total views.
sentences.chinese: 全市被犬类咬伤或抓伤人数累计达5523人次。

sentences.english: Cotton mittens will prevent the baby from scratching his own face .
sentences.chinese: 棉的连指手套使婴儿不会抓伤的脸。

sentences.english: While it is the strongest of jewellery metals, platinum can still scratch with everyday wear.
sentences.chinese: 虽然它是最强的珠宝金属，每天穿同白金仍可抓伤。

sentences.english: Emma told her mom that their cat had scratched her.
sentences.chinese: 艾玛告诉她妈妈，他们的猫抓伤了她。

sentences.english: T have to scratch your head hard.
Then, I had to wrap her in a blanket to keep her from scratching me.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我用毯子裹住她，以免被她抓伤。

sentences.english: After the cat had scratched Peter twice , he let it alone.
sentences.chinese: 彼得被猫抓伤两次之后，就不敢再招惹牠了。

sentences.english: One of the toddlers had reportedly scratched the other's face.
sentences.chinese: 据说其中的一个孩子幼儿抓伤了对方的脸。

sentences.english: Many couples often, although unintentionally, end up scratching each other's bodies with their sharp nails.
sentences.chinese: 很多情侣经常会无意中用自己锋利的指甲抓伤对方。

sentences.english: The cat scratched my younger sister.
The little dog actually came off better, with only a few scratches.
sentences.chinese: 这条小狗实际上是斗赢了，只是有几处抓伤而已。

sentences.english: Cotton mittens will prevent the baby from scratching his own face.
sentences.chinese: 棉的连指手套使婴儿不会抓伤自己的脸。

definition: to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
to scratch/to mess about with/to quarrel/to scramble to do/sb or sth that one can rely on
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
to tear at (with the teeth, like one animal attacking another)
